lyrics.line: Slip inside the eye of your mind, don't you know you might find, a better place to play?
You said that you'd never been, but all the things that you've seen, will slowly fade away.

chords.line: C. G. Am. E7. F. G. C. Am G
C. G. Am. E7. F. G. C. Am G

lyrics.line: So I start a revolution from my bed, 'Cause you said the brains I had went to my head, Step outside, summertime's in bloom
Stand up beside the fireplace, Take that look from off your face, You ain't ever gonna burn my heart out

chords.line: F. Fm6. C... F. Fm6. C... F. Fm6. C...

lyrics.line: And so Sally can wait, She knows it's too late, As we're walking on by
Her soul slides away, But don't look back in anger, I heard you say.

chords.line: C. G. Am. E7. F. G. C. Am G
C. G. Am. E7. F. G. C. Am G

lyrics.line: Take me to the place where you go, Where nobody knows, If it's night or day.
But please don't put your life in the hands, Of a rock and roll band, Who'll throw it all away.

chords.line: C. G. Am. E7. F. G. C. Am G
C. G. Am. E7. F. G. C. Am G
